org.purewidgets.server.application
Interface ApplicationLifeCycle

All Superinterfaces:
ActionListener
public interface ApplicationLifeCycle
extends ActionListener

This interface defines the methods for the application life-cycle. Life-cycle: loaded->(setup)->start->(onAction)->finish setup is only called the first time. onAction is only called if there is any input.

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

Method Summary
 void finish()
          Finish is called on every session, at the end.
 void loaded(PublicDisplayApplication application)
          Loaded is called for every session after the application is loaded (or created if it is the first time)
 void setup()
          Setup is called only once for each application and basically allows the application to initialize whatever datastructures it needs.
 void start()
          Called after loaded and setup.
 
Methods inherited from interface org.purewidgets.shared.events.ActionListener
onAction
 

Method Detail

loaded

void loaded(PublicDisplayApplication application)
Loaded is called for every session after the application is loaded (or created if it is the first time)

Parameters:
application -

setup

void setup()
Setup is called only once for each application and basically allows the application to initialize whatever datastructures it needs.

start

void start()
Called after loaded and setup. This allows applications to run code on every session after the application is loaded.

finish

void finish()
Finish is called on every session, at the end. Before finish is called there may be several onAction calls in result to user input and this is probably where most of the action will be. Finish allows the application to display results based on its current state and after integrating the potential user input.
